website_summaries.verdict: This disposable wrap is a little more expensive but dependable and well liked.
pros: Diaper has a little gather on the side to help hold in the urine and make it comfortable
Includes a wetness indicator so you know when your pet has wet the wrap
Works well for protecting your home from accidents
Also comes in a version for female dogs
cons: After the diaper is wet, it tends to get a little heavy for the closure and may come open

customer_reviews.title: If I didn't love him so much--these would have been a life saver.
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a control of my greatly loved terrier's mission to mark every upright surface in the house. Sadly not neutered at an early age, he has not been trainable, but is otherwise a great dog. These fit well, remain on, don't leak and seem to remind him that it is a bad idea to lift his leg in the house.
customer_reviews.author: starmoth

customer_reviews.title: Used to love these.  Now they are worthless.
customer_reviews.text: I used to love these, and had been using them on my dog for the past 6 months or so. But the last three packages that came in were horrible... the drapers are now bunching up right at the critical area, allowing urine to escape easily. I have come home to find the diaper dry and the floor wet where the dog peed. I suspect the design may have been changed, along with cheaper material causing the bunching? There used to be two sticky tabs on the diaper to fix them shut, but now it is one hook and loop / Velcro fastener. While fastening with one Velcro strip is easier to do, its worthless with the drapers not working.
customer_reviews.author: Aldwyn

customer_reviews.title: Velcro comes off
customer_reviews.text: I bought these months ago for our elderly dog to prevent accidents. The first batch I bought had two vertical Velcro strips and these worked great. I could reuse the diaper if not soiled. The newest batch has one horizontal Velcro strip. It will hold tight for about 1/2 hour. Then the strip comes totally detached from the diaper rendering it unusable. I use packaging tape to keep the diaper on. Either fix the issue with the Velcro coming off the diaper or better yet, go back to the two strips.
customer_reviews.author: Nhwhazup

customer_reviews.title: Rusty is 19 pound poodle mix and wears a medium ...
customer_reviews.text: Rusty is 19 pound poodle mix and wears a medium. He is 16 years old and wears them around the clock using 6 per day. They work well however are really full at the end of the night.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene M.

customer_reviews.title: Beware: Opened package, 9-count instead of 12. The seller is a scumbag
customer_reviews.text: The diapers are just ok - a bit narrow for a large dog. My dog is not that large. It is also easy for a dog to slip it off. The most disgusting thing about this is that when I opened the package, I noticed that it was previously opened and sealed with a scotch tape. Instead of 12 count, there were only 9 diapers. I hate cheating!!! I got to opening it a bit late, so there is no way to file a claim, but I will make sure to leave the worst review for the seller. Will never buy again!
customer_reviews.author: TKG

customer_reviews.title: Best I have found, excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This one worked for a 15 year old corgi. Diapers slid off my "loaf of bread" shaped dog. 35 lbs. After looking on Etsy for ideas, I put on his Puppia harness, ran a minky fabric belt ( from my robe) through the lead clip on the back of puppia. Diaper pinned the ends to the diaper to make a little suspender. Bravo! Only one leak so far, and it was due to the position of the diaper, not lack of absorbency. Much more light and comfortable for him than the washable ones I could never get a correct fit on. Charlie's skin is very sensitive. No chafing after 3 days of wearing them. Happy Momma!
customer_reviews.author: Nini

customer_reviews.title: I bought the small size because my dog weighs 15lbs and they fit him perfect but just didn't catch urine
customer_reviews.text: We had previously bought this same brand that had the straps (like diapers) instead of the strip made in the diaper to keep it secure. We had decent success with the straps but with this type, the diaper is dry with a puddle on the floor/carpet. I have tried to secure it many different ways and gone through two bags of this product and nothing seems to work. I seen another review about wiki wags, so I am going to try that next. I bought the small size because my dog weighs 15lbs and they fit him perfect but just didn't catch urine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recent quality of these is horrible.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these for many months for my very senior dog. I loved these up until the last month. The quality had gone downhill fast on these. If he didn't wet them when it came time to go outside I would reuse them. The velcro on these recently tore the wrap any time I went to take them off thereby destroying a perfectly good unused wrap and wasted money. I switched to another brand from Amazon that's a little more expensive but works wonderfully. And the new ones I don't have to tuck the ends under for comfort. All Absorb 30 pack.
customer_reviews.author: digems

customer_reviews.title: These are so-so
customer_reviews.text: We have two male chihuahuas, aka pee pee pants, and at 10 they aren't stopping any time soon. We have used belly bands but they leaked. We tried one pack of these. They are a pain to keep on, slide down/bunch up so we had to use two per dog. If you take them off and put them back on over two days the tape stops sticking. We ended up better off using fleece belly bands and Always with wings for women number 4 for absorbency. MUCH better than these.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle King

customer_reviews.title: Lower quality than other similar items on the market
customer_reviews.text: My 15-year old toy poodle needs doggy diapers from time to time. I have been buying the same brand for roughly a year and saw these and thought I'd try it out. These were not nearly as good as the other ones I have been buying and they cost more. The Velcro doesn't hold very well and they don't seem to hold as much liquid waste. I'd recommend purchasing another brand unless this is your only option. That being said, I plan to use all 12 that I bought. I will just use them during short periods and not when I know I'll be gone for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: ejyankee

customer_reviews.title: I don't like this product
customer_reviews.text: I really don't recommend that doesn't hold a lot of urine and don't attend into urine a lot especially my give him water all day I don't care what people say I change the water three or four times a day when I'm available because he doesn't know how to speak especially in the summer you need to have them refresh with the AC on and there water around I never have to go to the veterinarian because I know how to deal and the natural way with my baby
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Leak
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would try a different brand than my usual because it was cheaper and it had good reviews. BIG MISTAKE. I use these for my 15.5 yr old min poodle who has canine dementia and has completely forgotten about bathroom rules. He is about 14 pounds. The first one of these I put on him he soaked through it and then it leaked onto the floor, turned it all gummy when I took it off him. Ewwww! Glad I only bought a small package. These are worthless IMO. Will stay with AllAbsorb by Honey Care. Best ones I had found, no leaking and VERY absorbent.
customer_reviews.author: HAVE4PAWS

customer_reviews.title: Good product to help your buddy, but a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, but a little pricey. They do the job for our old guy who has developed age related incontinence and has no idea that he is leaking or dribbling. These take care of that for him and us, we don't have to wash his bed and blanket every day. He is a medium size dog, about 26 lbs and his waist measures about 20 inches, the medium were a perfect fit. The only reason for the 4 stars and not 5 was that these are very comparable to the amazon basics brand, but basics brand and much more reasonably priced. Same features, same design same fit and same reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: Belly bands are an easy way to deal with medical leaking issues
customer_reviews.text: Belly bands are the best for dogs who have medical issues and need a back up overnight or indoors. For extreme situations, putting XL Maxipads inside can increase volume and longevity. Be sure the edges are not folded under. Fit snugly. Dogs CAN roll on their backs and try to loosen these, so keep an eye on them. These can also discourage or prevent marking indoors, but should be combined with proper training and opportunities to go outside, along with neuter if that has not already been done. Healthy dogs of any age and size can learn. It may mean hiring a dog walker. There is no reason for any healthy dog to be peeing inside a home.
customer_reviews.author: RavenhillTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best in the market
customer_reviews.text: These are a quality of life game changer! They work really well if you make sure you apply them correctly. Easy to apply but dogs are all different builds. We loved these were thinking we had to put our 15 yr old CKD down at age 14 but these gave him new spunk and options! He and we were all able to finally sleep through the night mostly on account of these! They are hands down the best out there and blow the competition away. We used these in conjunction with the pee pass (reusable) and both items your brand matters. Other diapers leaked, shifted, didn’t fit well...these worked great with a tough dog.
customer_reviews.author: Vbcoastalsoul

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent
customer_reviews.text: I gave these pads 5 stars because they are excellent in every way, even though they don’t happen to work for my dog. Max is a rather rotund 14 year old shitzu weighing about 20 lbs. I got medium, and am certain the small would not have fit. The medium are good for going around him, but he hasn’t a “waist” so no matter how I secure the band, it slips off in short time. He doesn’t mind wearing it, just in normal movement falls off. Just to check, tried it on a larger, thinner dog, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mr max

customer_reviews.title: Work great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for two years on my male dog and they are fantastic. Easy to put on with the one Velcro strip. Also easy to get off and throw away. Are used washable ones for a while but the disposable ones honestly are so much easier. My male dog sometimes lifts his leg to mark in the house and these wraps allow me to leave him out and roam the house without worrying that he’s going to pee on something.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Polito

customer_reviews.title: Wish These Worked !
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how my lab can pee around these things, but somehow it happens. They don't stay in place, and I wouldn't want them to be too tight. I've tried a wrap around them, and I still come home to a flooded floor--and unless the other dogs are taking them off him, and then putting them back on before I get home, I can't figure out why they allow him to pee outside of the diapers----definitely would not use them again. I was warned that they wouldn't work, and I should have listened !
customer_reviews.author: hungrychawawa

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt open correctly
customer_reviews.text: I use to love these. But in the last year with a couple different orders I've gotten, some of the packages will have defective diapers, where they won't open on one side. Amazon Is supposed to refund the cost of one of the two packages I just received and I'm going to be trying to call the company themselves I will try to upload a video of this.
customer_reviews.author: C. Everitt

customer_reviews.title: Simply a Better Choice
customer_reviews.text: Petco used to carry this brand of Male Wraps, but they switched to another brand which had different sizing. The Small wraps were too small, and the Medium wraps were too big! I began shopping for them at Petsmart, but I was not happy with their prices. Then, we joined Amazon Prime and I found the favored "Vet's Best" brand there for about 40% less than what was available in stores! The "Vet's Best" are better fitting and I don't have to leave home to buy them! It's a "win, win" for me and my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Benoit

customer_reviews.title: Read this... Useless for French Bulldogs
customer_reviews.text: It is know anatomy of french bulldogs is quite different but the concept of a male diaper and this design is worthless. Don’t get me wrong, in this brand the material and Velcro are excellent but it is just the design, a dog does not have its penis in the belly specially a bulldog. So this time, worthless money. Suggestion get a pant, suspenders and use a women’s liners or a surgery overall with liners. Don’t waste you money like i did with this.
customer_reviews.author: SergioArb

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: These are GARBAGE. I put one on my dog, he rolled twice on the floor and it came off! I bought the reusable bands, but they were too small. So these had a good rating....but i have no idea how!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Last 2 batches are bad?
customer_reviews.text: Been using these male dog diapers for a couple years now after my dog had bladder surgery and now has incontinence issues. The last 2 bags of these diapers are bad! They don't stay on, they don't catch all the urine and/or any of the urine and I end up with a surprise mess. The quality control #'s are very different. One batch was made in 2018 and the other in 2019....so I'll be trying another brand.....I was just about to reorder - I buy them in bulk. I never had an issue until these 2 packages.....
customer_reviews.author: memememememe

customer_reviews.title: No more wet carpets and floors!
customer_reviews.text: I was discouraged after another brand I had tired stuck to my dog's tail fur, forcing me to cut off large chunks of fur to remove it, but these specifically said they are fur safe, and they ARE! They are very easy to put on and take off, and they work great for my elderly little pup who can no longer make it through the night without an accident. They stay on and in the right position, but don't irritate his skin. The diaper is full in the mornings, but that means the floors and carpets are dry. I've just ordered more and also started a subscription. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: ShopHappy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit and allows the dog to urinate outside the band
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because I was told by a friend that they were better than the ones we had and I like to keep disposables on hand while we wash the reusable sets. These are awful and we will be going back to the other brand. These don’t catch the urine. They don’t cover the dog’s belly and they bunch up and slip so that the dog is able to urinate outside the band. It totally defeated the purpose. Look elsewhere...we have teacup chihuahuas and bought smalls. They simply do not fit properly or work effectively.
customer_reviews.author: WJ

customer_reviews.title: Not Vet's Best
customer_reviews.text: They work pretty well, except I ordered larger ones probably than needed, and after they are taken off and on (to go outside to potty) sometimes they don't want to stick again because the adhesive pulls off. Also it is not easy to avoid it sticking to the dog's hair (and pulling it off). I prefer a different brand and have learned that just because "Vet" is in the product title, it doesn't necessarily mean it's a superior product.
customer_reviews.author: Constance Ferrari

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product, my dog doesn't fill it like a diaper, so I don't know how much urine it holds, but for me these were the greatest find ever, for marking -- my dog would mark if we left him home alone and even inside the car, finding this product was such a relief -- then my dog figured out how to get them off -- first try he wiggled on his back and the velcro came loose -using packing tape over the velcro to hold -- my dog then decided to crawl on his tummy to work his wrap off. Aargh!
customer_reviews.author: Mom2020

customer_reviews.title: Leak-proof but poor sizing
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE LEAK-PROOF! My bulldog likes to pee inside and these help to save my carpet, and my sanity. He is 65 pounds with a big bladder and these diapers are able to hold it. The Velcro-like closure can be used over and over again if I want to reuse a clean diaper he didn't pee in. The ONLY complaint I have is the sizing. Medium is too snug and large falls off him. It's frustrating. I opt for the medium as the large hangs off of him and tends not to capture all the urine.
customer_reviews.author: Aim

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defect, no velcro.
customer_reviews.text: We buy a lot of these. Unfortunately, we stack them up and can miss return windows. There are 2 styles shipped more or less randomly. One has horizontal Velcro strips, the other has vertical Velcro tabs. This time, we got a whole package with neither. 100% unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dorosky

customer_reviews.title: Wet diaper = wet dog
customer_reviews.text: The size small fits my 7-1/2 lb. Maltese very comfortably. The diaper holds the wetness in and off the floors, however, when the dog wets the diaper, there is nothing to keep the wetness inside the diaper and away from his fur; so he ends up soaked and needing a bath every time he wets the diaper. I will go back to using inexpensive infant diapers (for my dog, size 16-28 lbs works) put on sideways - they look awkward, but they work like a charm- no wet floors - no wet dog!!
customer_reviews.author: patti

customer_reviews.title: Vet' Best Wrap
customer_reviews.text: This wrap absorbs well and seems to be comfortable. However my dog has figured out how to wiggle out of them. I have to put a pair of male toddler underwear on with these. I modified the underwear to have a type of "suspender" strap. I used a wide cotton cloth that was long enough to place just below his collar and cross on his back. Where the fabric crosses on his back that is sewn together so it will not slip or choke him. I then hook the ends to the top of the underwear giving a suspender effect. Works. These wraps can not be wiggled out of when I use the modified underpants.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Deason

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: I got these because they would arrive sooner than some of the other brands. And we needed them, for our pitbull is recently handicap. I was excited when I got them because they came quickly and they looked exactly like the other ones we had been using, but unfortunately every single time we have used this brand they have leaked. If it hadn’t been for the brand previously, I would have given up and assumed all of the wraps worked like this. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bri Stanton

customer_reviews.title: I like that they're reusable so you're not wasting them simply ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a friend who's dog is a little wizzer. I used these bands and not only was my furniture and carpet safe, it actually prevented him from marking. I like that they're reusable so you're not wasting them simply because they won't stick after the first use. I bought a medium for a small cockapoo and it was a perfect fit. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Quality when it counts
customer_reviews.text: We had adopted our 16th rescue dog over 38 years and this fellow has a little bit of an incontinence problem. We tried other brands, but the quality and securing of the wrap is not there. These wraps hold very good, absorb like they should and even have a color code to tell you when they have gone. Don't spare the agony of others, go for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Meathead

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I was using a belly band from a local pet store until I noticed that it was too tight and left a marking on my fur baby's little man parts and that's a no no. These work really well and they're not too tight. I did order a medium to give him some room but i will def order a small next time. I have a 13lb yorkiepoo FYI Edit: I ordered small and they were TOO small. I will stick with the medium
customer_reviews.author: Roshunda

customer_reviews.title: What a good find
customer_reviews.text: This product is so helpful. I have a dog with incontinence and these diapers have changed my life. For me, they have been leak proof and their absorbency has allowed me NOT to have to change diapers during the night. These diapers can last through the night. My dog seems comfortable wearing them and I find them easy to put on and take off. Truly a helpful product.
customer_reviews.author: annabel

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy.
customer_reviews.text: Worst diaper ever. Velcro falls off making them useless. Was trying another brand to cut costs because the diapers I like are top paw and cost about $18 for 12 but apparently are worth every penny. My dog doesn't pee every time he wears it and still gets up to go outside so I remove the diaper and put it back on when he comes in sometimes 6 times. These Fallout 50% of the time before he's even peed them, and cannot be put back on.
customer_reviews.author: DanyTheGirl

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, absorbent and they work!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these male wraps for my 50 pound springer spaniel! They are a lifesaver since he is on medication that makes him urinate a lot and lose control. I did run into a problem with one defective wrap in the pack - see picture. The end was torn and did not adhere to the Velcro. Other than that, they are great!
customer_reviews.author: B.D.R.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your $$$$
customer_reviews.text: I spent $20 for wraps that fall right off. On a sleek costed dog, these will slide to the tail area, down the legs, where he then just steps on out!! There is no problem with the Velcro, or the size. There is just nothing to hold it in place, such as, a sticky or rubbery spot to cling to the dog. I’m just angry.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie P.

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect.
customer_reviews.text: They’re perfect for my 25lb corgi named Butterbeer. He’s got degenerate myelopathy and recently he became incontinent. I ordered a size medium.
customer_reviews.author: Mags Per

customer_reviews.title: Well when they don't bunch up
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give this 5 stars all around but these wraps do not fit my dog well. They bunch up under his hips. I have to double them up (side by side) in order for them to not bunch up. He is not trying to get out of them though. He tolerates them well even when doubled up. I ordered the correct size for his measurements and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer7

customer_reviews.title: and this one fits and works the best. It's also comfortable for my dog and doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried lots of "diapers" for my little pomeranian rescue dog who has a potty problem, and this one fits and works the best. It's also comfortable for my dog and doesn't rub him in the wrong places. And it's comfortable to me to hold him when he's wearing it. I'd recommend this to anyone I know that owns a dog and needs a diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have an approx 80lb pit husky, who started raising his leg in the house after a new move and baby. Nothing has deterred him from doing so, and I’ve tried numerous different ways to get him to stop. So dog diapers was a last ditch effort to save furniture, and they stay on, absorb (he only marks, doesn’t full on pee so the full absorbency hasn’t been tested) but I’d rather buy these than clean up pee multiple times a day. I’m already changing my sons diapers, might as well change my dogs too now.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Will not be buying these again
customer_reviews.text: These are thin and stiff. They don't fit well and don't stay in place well and also don't absorb as fast as they should so we had leakage several times. Went back to our regular brand which costs more but works so much better. I would not recommend these and I will not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I have used these make wraps for My paralyzed dachshund for over 6 months, and these wraps are the best quality I have found plus costs less than local pet store. I order 3+ packs A month. A few months ago I received a couple of packs that had a different closure system, I was unhappy that they changed the product without notice so I left a 2 star review.... I should have tested the new product first because they were GREAT, maybe even better than the original .
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Lee

customer_reviews.title: Used to be 5 Stars until...
customer_reviews.text: Before I received my last order --of eight packs, I might add--I would've given these 5 stars. They are absorbent. They used to stay on really well. They fit my Pomeranian--he weighs 7 pounds and so gets an extra small. I'm very disappointed that they changed the closure strips, because I now often come home to a wet diaper on the floor as well as another spot on the carpet. Their change from two strip to one strip closures is a disaster and I would send them all back if I had a better alternative. Change is not always good.
customer_reviews.author: maggie

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for Older Dogs
customer_reviews.text: If you have an older male dog like I do these are an essential quality of life addition to your life. They are not the perfect solution, but for the most part keep the dog and the house dry when there would be countless accidents otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Taylor-White

customer_reviews.title: Great male wraps
customer_reviews.text: Great male wraps!!I bought male dog male wraps from Petco that were twice the price & wouldn't stay on my dog...Vet's Best are great, my American Eskimo is 26 pounds & the medium fit perfect, never fall off & so far haven't leaked. My dog has diabetes so he dribbles all the time...I also line them with cheap "feminine products" from Wal-Mart and they last much longer, just remove the wet one & put a clean dry one in...works perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

customer_reviews.title: What a great product! I HIGHLY recommend
customer_reviews.text: What a great product! I HIGHLY recommend. My 16 year old male has issues at times and these are wonderful. He adapted from the first day and the marking stopped. He waits for me to remove it before he goes outside and this has reinforced his going outside to urinate so a wrap is wet less frequently. Upon his return, he stops and waits for his wrap to be reapplied. The wraps can be removed and reapplied a number of times (if not wet). Easy on and off and when accidents happen, the wrap holds the urine well. No more wetting his bed or ours.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Size up. Charts are wrong
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the size recommend by the seller and they were too small and kept falling off. I tried about 3 of them and realized they just do not fit. The sizing charts are wrong. I need a larger size. Now I'm stuck with something I can not use. Its apparent the seller has no response and dose not care.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Best Disposable Male Wrap!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several male wraps and I believe these are the best ones in the disposable arena. 1. They fit my Havanese well (20 lbs and we buy medium)) 2. They don't bunch up on him and are easy to get off and on 3. He sleeps well with it on and doesn't try to get out of it 4. It's never leaked 5. It doesn't put pressure marks on him or cause him discomfort 6. Can use over and over, if not soiled 7. Seems to be the most comfortable
customer_reviews.author: S. Riche

customer_reviews.title: Defective and Quantity Incorrect
customer_reviews.text: Did not receive the correct product. Order very clearly states I ordered a 30 count package, and I only received 12 diapers. Additionally, what I received is defective. I use this exact brand, size and product for my dog daily, multiple times per day, for over a year and all of a sudden with this order they are leaking everywhere and the part where you secure the diaper seems defective. These are either knockoffs or the rejects that the company decided to package and sell? All in all I am extremely unhappy with this purchase. Will buy from Chewy as I have done in the past - this way I can ensure reliable source and not a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Kozlowski

customer_reviews.title: Good for older dogs
customer_reviews.text: These work for my older male lab. He has trouble with his bladder and this keeps the mess to a minimum. You do have to wash the underside of your dog if he das laid down after wetting himself. But it does keep my dog for having accidents on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Worked, both to prevent pee on the floor, and as a training aid to stop future incidents.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, these things worked great! Our new dog had the dreaded 'submissive urination' issue. We were just hoping that these would keep the dog pee off the floor, but these turned out to not only do that (which they did very well), but in the space of about 2 weeks, trained our dog to stop peeing everytime someone told him he was a good boy. Seemed like the biofeedback (ie: he could feel when he was peeing with these on) made him aware of what he was doing, and he smartened right up. YAY!
customer_reviews.author: BrotherJack

customer_reviews.title: Fit is great.
customer_reviews.text: Based on other reviews I was hesitant to purchase but I’m glad I did. I have a small, older dog who only needs these at night. Other brands with the two tabs were too wide and would slip even when tightened. I love the narrowness ofnthese. They cover just where needed. Also, I find the Velcro very easy to use and reposition as needed.
customer_reviews.author: frequentshopper210

customer_reviews.title: Decrease quality
customer_reviews.text: I rescue dogs and have always bought this brand and they have been great. However my last order they were thinner and the velcro failed to stay fasten. I don’t know if the company decided to change and decrease the quality of their product and continue to charge the same price
customer_reviews.author: monica fitch

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good disposable wrap but...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for quite sometime and have been very happy with the product. My only complaint is that this last time I attempted to reorder these, you are only allowed one package per customer per order. I am now trying other brands to see what works for my doggo so that I can order multiple packages at a time. I would give these a 4-star rating but the limitations on quantity are a definite drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Snow

customer_reviews.title: Runs small in my opinion.
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a 20 inch waist and I bought the appropriate size but should have bought a size up. I could barely get it around him and used only one before abandoning them. I'm sure I'll find other uses for the rest of the pack. If your dogs waist is on the edge of the high end of the size, get the next size up. You can always make it smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Laiuppa

customer_reviews.title: Great, when no defects.
customer_reviews.text: We tried a pack of these and liked them, so we subscribed 3 packs per month. Half of the diapers in two of the last 3 packs are defective; we haven't opened the 3rd yet. The side 'flaps' are stuck to the body of the diapers. Unfolding them rips the rest. I haven't contacted anyone yet, but am cancelling my subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: A god sent. Seriously. My elderdog is 17.5 and he is incontinent and these have been such a great tool to have. Particularly overnight. I usually put him in non-disposable ones during the day, but overnight, these are fantastic. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ulrike

customer_reviews.title: Great absorbency!
customer_reviews.text: At first the diaper fell right off due to the velcro coming undone, but make sure you open the whole diaper before use. I use 2 little clips to make sure it wont come off and this has been great at absorbing all the urine from my 57lb german shepherd.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Great...and a surprising additional bonus!
customer_reviews.text: My springer puppy, while being trained, needed these for his "excitement peeing" however.....I found a fabulous by product of these, by accident, on the Fourth of July. The booming of my neighbors setting off their 'crakers made my boy freak a little and he did a little piddle walking...so I grabbed one of these and put it on...nice and snug as usual.....and lo and behold....he immediately calmed down and jumped on the bed and promptly fell asleep. No more freaking or crying...so yay. These were a real lifesaver...not just for that, but also for the training. Easy to put on and take off....and they hold quite a lot of pee also.
customer_reviews.author: Tally momny

customer_reviews.title: Price doubled after several orders
customer_reviews.text: The small would not staying covering my male shih tzu’s parts. I had to go to a wider medium which was then to big around. I have to make the length around shorter by folding and stapling one end. It still doesn’t stay covering his parts ( still slides down or squishes up). So I had to add a pantry liner to the front. All of this is a pain but because the price was so good I’ve stuck with it. This time I go to order and the price has doubled so it will probably be my last order and I will try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: KPo

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! I used them to travel with my medium sized dog to avoid any possible accidents. The diapers are easy to wrap around and they did not leak after my dog had relieved himself. Furthermore, his fur surrounding the diaper area was completely dry, which was a pleasant surprise to me. I have used different dig diapers before and this is by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: Cons

customer_reviews.title: Best Pet Disposal Diapers/Wraps on the Market! Don't waste your money on the other brands.
customer_reviews.text: Best male disposable diapers for your male/female dog on the market today. Won't buy anything else. Amazon has the best package size and price around. These are great for those times when your furry friend starts getting older and having some leaking issues and being able to hold it all night long. Very absorbing and can be removed and placed on again without destroying the taps because of the tabs design. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: DHamilton2005

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give more stars but I ordered the large and somehow he slipped it off every night I tried using them. Seems like a great idea but I just ordered the more "diaper" type to see if it's better. These just didnt stay on him and I would get up to the pad on the floor with a pee puddle next to it or somewhere in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Srofe

customer_reviews.title: No more wee wee wee all through our home!
customer_reviews.text: This product is used on my mom’s elderly poodle that has lost his hearing & his eye sight. This product has been great! It is exactly what was needed to control accidents in the home. They work great! Absorb great!! Fit is great!!
customer_reviews.author: Bettye Jean James

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this became a necessity with my 16 year old Maltese. Fit was great and it does the job
customer_reviews.author: Mariela Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and absorbent
customer_reviews.text: This fit our chi boy perfectly ! He pees every night before we get up to let him out or sometimes even 5 min after coming inside! It’s not a tinkle either it’s a full blown pee! This saves our carpet!! Love that they are disposable ! Life savers!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great job
customer_reviews.text: I foster dogs for animal rescue. I recently had a dog that needed physical therapy following hip surgery. It made him pee nervously. I used these on him just during his sessions. These had enough give to allow his legs and hips to be manipulated as well as for him to walk. Contained his spray completely. I will definitely buy these again if I have another foster dog in a similar need.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Nice waste diaper if It fit properly. I ordered a medium and it was too big, then ordered a small and still too big. I think this diaper either runs bigger or it just isn’t fitted snuggly. If it fit correctly diaper would be ok.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Leaky, didn't hold urine
customer_reviews.text: Bought these wraps for my older male German Shepherd, I had used Top Paw Brand before but decided to try this brand. They did not hold as much urine as the Top Paw Brand and leaked when full. As you can see in the picture the absorbent pad in the Vet's Best pad is not nearly as large as the one in the Top Paw brand. Amazon's price for the Top Paw XL Disposable Male Wraps is crazy though, $34.98, I bought them at Petsmart for $18.99 for the exact same package, 12 wraps. So I am sending these back and ordering from Petsmart.
customer_reviews.author: TDuke

customer_reviews.title: They don't fall off
customer_reviews.text: Vet's Best features a velcro-like fastener that runs the width of the band, so the it doesn't come undone, as do the brands that have only tabs to fasten the band.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent
customer_reviews.text: Like these, very absorbent and like the Blue Line indicator. However, do wish they had X-large size. My 14 yr. old lab mix has Cushing's Disease, so has many accidents. With the pot belly being a symptom of Cushing's, it would be more comfortable for my Bernie if larger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive
customer_reviews.text: The diapers are good for my dog but it is too expensive. Now I use Kroger men's diaper for my dog. It is much cheeper, only $7.99 for 52 pieces and works perfectly for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Edith

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay on
customer_reviews.text: this product does not have a glue type adhesion. It is in theory good because if it is unused it is easy to put on again. It more of a velcro type. The problem is it barely sticks. It is best to use under a fabric diaper with velcro. Please now that I ordered the right size(2nd time) and there is plenty of room to g around my doggy's belly.
customer_reviews.author: Joann Palileo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: These wraps are terrible! They don't fit right (too big even though I used the size chart), and the Velcro sticks for all of about 5 minutes. If I could return these, I would...but I threw away the outside packaging. I'm going back to my usual brand.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Walker

customer_reviews.title: Absorbency is good but the velcro is weak and the wrap comes undone.
customer_reviews.text: These wraps absorb good but the velcro sucks so they come undone frequently. I was willing to put up with it because of the great price ($5) but they just doubled it so I’ll be going back to the Amazon Basics brand where you get more than twice as many (30ct) for $4 more ($15) and the velcro actually sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Shariece

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Every diaper in this packaging was defective. The Velcro tape that hold it together was not secured on the diaper. I had to staple it tape it on. Very frustrating and bothersome for how much you pay.
customer_reviews.author: Paula D

customer_reviews.title: It is leak proof!
customer_reviews.text: I found a solution for long periods of time in the car! My dog it's an old Doxie ,he has emergencies all the time....today he used the diaper for the first time,and it worked! We are ready for a long trip 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No tape on 2 of them
customer_reviews.text: Two so far were unusable because they had no tape on one end, haven't checked them all yet. Really disappointing for the price. They do work fine for my dog but I wouldn't re-order this brand because it's a waste of money getting ones that can't be used.
customer_reviews.author: sloro

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 15 year old Malamute. He did not mind wearing them from the first time. Easy to put on, and remove. I used two, one over lapping the one in back about half way. Usually the one in front was not wet or damaged, and could be used again. This was to stop a little leakage if you got the first one on a little two far back. My system worked great doing this, and only a couple times was there any leakage, unless you left them on too long. Overall they worked great, other than price, but they are all sort of expensive. Buy the bulk, 144 count.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: recently adopted a senior male pug who just got neutered ...
customer_reviews.text: recently adopted a senior male pug who just got neutered recently. He likes to mark. These are a quick solution for when I'm not watching him in the house. Unfortunately my husband gets frustrated with a wiggly butt who won't stand still to put the tabs on well for him. They are reusable and fit my 22 pound pug. I just put him between my legs and strap it on no issues but the tabs if you've never used human diapers can be challenging. I made a belly band with wide Velcro straps for hubby to use when I am not home.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia C. Longacre

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love these disposable doggie diapers. I have a senior doggie an he has accidents from time to time an these have been my saving grace. They work very well and he seems very comfortable in them.
customer_reviews.author: vern

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT LEAK
customer_reviews.text: I have 20 lb Toy Fox terrier with a waste measurement of 21" and the medium fits him perfectly. So far, I've tried three other brands of dog diapers, including Amazon Basics dog wraps, and I find the Vets Best diapers to be the best. Unlike other male dog diapers, these diapers DO NOT LEAK. Yes, they are more pricey, but the overall quality and absorbency of these diapers is far superior to all others. .
customer_reviews.author: BARBARA FIEDLER

customer_reviews.title: Vet's Best is Best
customer_reviews.text: I bought and used this brand for the last week and half of my beloved pet's time here with me. I had tried another disposable brand and a re-usable brand, neither was as good as Vet's Best. The wrap is easy to put on and remove. The "wetness indicator" is an excellent feature. The closure worked beautifully. The wrap stayed in place (with the understanding that my pet was immobile). I used the large size for my 70+ lb german shepherd. Vet's Best made a tough situation a little more workable in a time of need.
customer_reviews.author: CJH

customer_reviews.title: Works when the stay on.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs can get out of these. Yes I have the right size, they curl up while putting the thing on then stretch out and drag themselves across a surface and it slides off.😳
customer_reviews.author: Judy S.

customer_reviews.title: Woof woof!
customer_reviews.text: My goodness! Life saver for my mini poodle! It's part of my subscription! Usually he can hold it most of the time but there is that one time or so a week, where he must had drank too much water so this diaper comes to the rescue. No more coming home wondering where he peed. I keep reusing the diaper until he actually pees on it. He wears a size medium. Some times I get two different type of diaper - I actually prefer and love the one that comes with a strip of Velcro. There's been time where I get one with two tabs Velcro.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit and comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I buy these regularly for nightly use on my male yorkie because he cannot hold it through the night. They seem to stay on, fit, and be more comfortable than other wraps I have pruchased. He is 6 lbs and wears a small. The extra small will fit him as well but are much snugger.
customer_reviews.author: Penny M. Appleton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for My Alpha-Male Territory Marker
customer_reviews.text: I have three male dogs, and although all are neutered, my middle one tends to try to mark his territory indoors. I previously wore the cloth wraps on him to help prevent his markings, but then I got what I call a "rubber stamp effect" when the urine would leak through and he'd lie here or there, leaving a small wet mark. These VetsBest disposable wraps were perfect for my needs. I actually use them in conjunction with the cloth wraps I find at the local pet stores for a double-duty barrier to protect the corners of my furniture. I highly recommend these to anyone with stubborn alpha male territory markers!
customer_reviews.author: Wescot

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to measure you pup before buying
customer_reviews.text: Small fits my 20lb dog well. Attached pictures to show his size... the dog in the second photo would be too small for these, or would need to trim the tabs. The tabs taper a bit and that helps them stay in place better.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: These are great for my westies
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my westies. they fit true to size. The medium is true mediums as westies are small to medium size dogs. One of my dogs have a prostatic tumor, therefore, he drips blood and these are great when he cannot hold in urine and have accidents. They hold in the moisture like baby diapers and fit my pooches comfortably I will be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Freedom

customer_reviews.title: Stayed in place despite the dog's best efforts, & didn't leak
customer_reviews.text: My elderly 20-pound male terrier developed cognitive dysfunction (doggie dementia) and forgot all his potty training. He wiggled out of doggie diapers from the pet store, but these stayed on him, stayed in place, and caught all the urine with no leak-through. He wore these for a long road trip in the car and while visiting my parents in their brand-new house (where a dog peeing on the rug would NOT have been welcome). No problems. For at home, we used washable cloth diapers to save money, but while on the go these were a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Jill E. Bean

customer_reviews.title: Good product but too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I was buying these for my senior male dog and they were working really well. Then out of nowhere they more than doubled the price. I’ll be looking for a replacement product now as I don’t feel the value is there for such a price increase.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine H

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: These work great on my 13 year old dog. He is only 12 lbs, but I'd diabetic. I use them when we go to other people's houses. I actually like them better than the reusable belly bands. But we don't have to use them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Solution to Old Doggie's URINE Leakage
customer_reviews.text: These fit my small dog of 12 lbs. After having a frustrating time trying doggie diapers, I found this to be perfect for a male dog. The wrap catches urine and holds it without leaking. The wrap's adhesive strips are re-usable, so if the wrap isn't soiled, you can use it again. The color at the bottom of the wrap tells you if it needs to be replaced. I tried other brands, but prefer Vet's Best.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Beverly

customer_reviews.title: New design no bueno
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time reordering a large quantity and was extremely disappointed in the new design. The diaper is much thinner and of cheaper material. The full Velcro tab also does not hold as well as the double tab from the previous design. Please go back to the original design, they were reliable. Strongly considering looking for a different brand since my dog has had leak issues with this new product.
customer_reviews.author: Isaura Carmona

customer_reviews.title: I tried these as well as a cheaper brand. ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried these as well as a cheaper brand. Now that the price has been lowered and they are only about 75 cents more than the cheaper brand, I will buy these exclusively. They have a much larger pad than the cheaper brand and work especially well for "overnight" diapers.
customer_reviews.author: C. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Fur safe fasteners do not fasten.
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like the perfect answer to my min pin’s leaking problem. It has the potenial to be, except when you wrap the pad around the the dog's waist the fasteners do not hold. The" velcro wnnna be” barely catches and at the least movement it opens. I wasn't even able to tape it together as nothing sticks to the slick paper. Not even duct tape which sticks to almost everything. A big disapointment.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Dog was allergic to this product
customer_reviews.text: When my dog's allergies are acting up, he chews on his penis until it is raw. He is on allergy pills, but I notice he was always worse after going to the groom which is the only time he wears the pads. The next grooming, I requested he not have the pad on, and instead kenneled him to avoid marking. Voila, no allergic activity! I donated the remainder of the package as well as the brand new one to the groomer to use on her other dribblers/markers. I won't put this on my dog again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Vet’s Best Comfort Fit Disposable Male Dog Diapers | Absorbent Male Wraps with Leak Proof Fit
product_meta.description: Size:Medium| Style:30ctProtect your home from accidents, and restore peace of mind for you and your pet with Vet's Best comfort fit disposable Male dog wraps. These male diapers are an effective solution for urinary incontinence, excitable urination, and male marking. Fur-safe, repositionable fasteners are easy to use for a secure and dependable fit. A wetness indicator lets you know when it's time to change the comfort-fit diaper. You and your dog will love them.
feature_bullets: Comfortable - Vet’s best comfort-fit disposable Male Wraps in the Medium size fits male dogs with an 18 - 23.5 inch waist.
Versatile - a perfect, disposable solution for managing your male dog’s urinary incontinence, excitable urination, and marking. Makes traveling with your pet easier.
Confidence - Each Vet’s best disposable Male dog wrap is Manufactured with a wetness indicator. At a glance you will know when it is time to change the Diaper.
Safe and snug - Our male dog diapers have Fur-safe, repositionable fasteners to give you the best fit every time, while the leak barrier gives you peace of mind.
Simple convenience - 30 large disposable Male dog wraps per pack.
